main.name: Jonathan Spratley
main.description: I create components and apps using HTML/CSS/JS.
main.bio: Experienced Software Developer adept in bringing forth expertise in design, installation, testing and maintenance of software systems.  Able to effectively self-manage during independent projects, as well as collaborate as part of a productive team.
main.contactmessage: Here is where you should write your message to readers to have them get in contact with you.

resume.skillmessage: Skilled in various front-end technologies, here are my favorites.

education.description: Took various computer science courses, then decided to teach myself.

work.title: Senior Software Engineer
work.description: Led team of software engineers driving full stack development.Implemented UI designs using CSS3, HTML5 and JavaScript. Developed programs to improve the effectiveness and overall operation of the team.

work.title: Instructor
work.description: Served as a mentor for developers located in Italy. Curated curriculum on novice JavaScript fundamentals. Second course involed more advaced JavaScript including design patterns.

work.title: UI Developer
work.description: Developed front-end components by using HTML5, CSS3 and JavaScript. Worked closely with stakeholders to gather functional and technical requirements.

work.title: Author
work.description: Wrote curriculum for process driven chapters. Demonstrated how to use open-source tools to streamline the development process. Collaborated with Quality control to ensure tutorials work across multiple platforms.

work.title: Instructor
work.description: Curated Flash UI/UX Development curriculum for mobile applications. Taught 1-on-1 students on using Flash IDE for mobile development. Covered basics of using Flash in mobile development.

work.title: UI Developer
work.description: Implemented UI designs using semantic HTML & Javascript. Collaborated with system engineers on API design specs. Implemented TDD into software development lifecylce.

work.title: Director of Product Design
work.description: Designed and developed client-side architecture using AngularJS.Designed and implemented server-side infrastructure using PHP and Node.Designed and developed API interfaces for mobile applications.Designed and developed custom components using Angular, Node, jQuery.

publications.title: Learning Yeoman
publications.subtitle: Packt
publications.body: Build a web application using Yeoman and the scaffolding tool Yo to save time and therefore money! Learn how to use and customize Yeoman generators such as Angular and Backbone to streamline project development.

publications.title: AngularJS Component
publications.subtitle: Safari Books
publications.body: For this post we are going to choose a very good HTML5 Canvas charting library. It goes by the name of ChartJS, and it has many charts that are very easy to use.

publications.title: Using HTML5 Web Speech
publications.subtitle: Safari Books
publications.body: The Web Speech API provides an alternative input method for web applications (without using a keyboard). Developers can give web applications the ability to transcribe voice to text, from the computer’s microphone

publications.title: Testing AngularJS with Jasmine
publications.subtitle: Safari Books
publications.body: In this tip, we will be learning how to test AngularJS applications and code using Jasmine, which is a behavior-driven development framework for testing JavaScript code.

publications.title: Meteor Web Apps
publications.subtitle: Safari Books
publications.body: In this post we will talk about using Meteor, which is an ultra-simple environment for building modern web applications. What once took weeks, even with the best tools, now takes hours with Meteor.

publications.title: Yeoman Web Apps
publications.subtitle: Safari Books
publications.body: In this post we will discuss using Yeoman, which is a client-side stack that contains three tools and frameworks to help developers quickly build beautiful and scalable web applications.
